Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the final one in the science of medicine, by completing it, by its exposition, and by its declaration, it seems to me that I complete it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the manual operation, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the manual operation is widespread in our region and our time, completely neglected, to the point that the science of it is in great danger, and its practice is lost; and only a few small descriptions remain in the books of the Ancients, which have been distorted by the hands of others and have fallen into error and hesitation, so that the understanding of it is closed and its strength and art are diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revitalize it [the manual operation] by the arrangement of this treatise, in accordance with the method of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; and so that it will be provided with the forms of cautery instruments and other instruments of the craft, as is necessary by adding a declaration and by preparing it.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skilled artisan is not found with his own hands in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that its practitioner must previously be versed in the science of anatomy, which recounts the body's parts, their shapes, their junctions and separations; and be aware of the bones, nerves, and tendons, their number, and their origins; and of the pulsating and still veins, and the places from which they come forth.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates says that with one name is little, but in the work little, and more so in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book, for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said about anatomy, is not spared from falling into error, by which men will die, just as I have seen many such, for some are trained in this science and throw themselves into it without knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and unskilled doctor lance a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some of the neck's arteries, so that a great deal of blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor attempt to remove a stone from a man who had suffered for many years, and the stone was large, and he came to him and removed that stone with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I myself warned him to refrain, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew beforehand that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another surgeon, who took a stipend from a duke in our land, and came to a dark-complexioned man whose thigh was fractured; and the surgeon, through his ignorance, straightened the fracture, pressing on the wound with pads and splints with excessive force, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he unbound it according to his desires, and then he bound it again, and then he left it for several days and commanded that we unbind the ligament; and it remained like this until the thigh and the leg became abscessed, and it perished.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I proceeded to unbind the ligament, and tranquility was achieved, and thus he was relieved of his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile, the corruption had already been established in the limb, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption continued to spread in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who pierced a cancerous abscess, and it ulcerated for several days, until the evil of it, with the patient's own body, was greatly magnified.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the cancerous ulcer is pure melancholy humor, so it should not be addressed with iron in its entirety, but rather the limb should be afflicted by being wholly removed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical operation be divided into two phases: one is the operation associated with health, and the other is the work that carries significant risk in the most vulnerable conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already shown this throughout this book, where operations carry error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to avoid this and abandon it, lest the leaves (or chapters) find a way to speak and bring dishonor upon you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and God's protection, and your patients with skill and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best approach, by God's grace, to achieve health and commendable success, and abandon the dreadful illnesses with difficult cures, and remove from your tools whatever makes you fearful, so that your zeal and your name are not lost. For greater glory awaits you, and even higher in the world and beyond your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia has already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, lest you be called bad doctors".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, discusses the types of instruments and the tools for cauteries, and everything necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting and piercing, cupping, poultices, and the extraction of arrows and similar objects,  is fully described and ordered by the types of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twisting and similar injuries; ordered from head to foot, and detailing the types of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to describe the benefits of this cautery and its harms, and in which constitution cauterization is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discussion of the benefits and harms of cautery is a long, detailed, and subtly scientific discourse, a secret hidden from view; many wise men have spoken of it, and they have disagreed, but a small part of their discussions will suffice for me, fearing to prolong the writing.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery benefits all constitutions universally, whether with or without matter, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with matter, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial for it, and others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for an illness which is caused by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is unsuitable for a hot and dry illness to be cured with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite claim that cautery provides benefit in all hot and dry illnesses affecting the human body, for when you compare the body and its humors to the nature of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, concerning that matter, that my own experience has revealed this to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be adopted by anyone who has not already been thoroughly practiced and trained in the chapter of cautery through prior exercises, and has grasped the diversity of human constitutions, the nature of illnesses and their various characteristics, their causes, their symptoms, and the timeframe involved.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, there is no need for such hesitation, and especially in cold and humid illnesses, for all physicians have agreed upon this, and there is no disagreement about the benefits of cautery in those cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire, and its efficacy, lies in contrast to cautery with medicinal agents.  The action of fire is direct, affecting only the part that is cauterized, and does not harm other, nearby, parts except to a minimal degree.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of a burning medicine extends to adjacent parts, and very easily causes a difficult-to-heal illness in a nearby limb, and often results in hearing loss.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its intensity and beneficial nature, does not do this unnecessarily. This is known to us through experiment and prolonged study of the art, concerning the truth of causes.  Therefore, I excuse myself from further lengthy discourse.  If it were not that this topic, concerning the secret of fire's use, is not included in my written text, and if the method of its operation in the body, and the expulsion of illnesses through it, were not already discussed in a detailed philosophical demonstration, which could enlighten your understanding.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the best time for cautery, and they suggest the springtime as the most suitable time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is appropriate at any time, because the potential harm from a delay is outweighed by the benefit of the cautery itself, and especially if the cautery is needed for intense and sudden pain, pains which cannot tolerate delay, as the potential for greater harm from the disease is feared more than the slight harm of a delay.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not for your understanding, children, or it is not considered by sensible doctors; this is, that for an illness cured by cautery, there is no single best time, and they suggest that conclusion.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not as they think about it; for cautery is not just any treatment, but a method that alters the temperament and dries the moistures that cause the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cautery is superior to other treatments because of its power, efficacy, and the greatness of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness will return at some time, depending on the patient's temperament, the location of the illness, and the strength of the illness itself, and the accumulation of superfluities within them, and what they have consumed in food and similar things; however, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a minor illness in a limb with few superfluities and moistures, like toothache and similar ailments, then it is possible that the pain will not return, but this is done gradually.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and it is a true statement, not in the way they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that is as effective as cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is the opposite of that; and the understanding that cautery is the last resort in medicine is only true when we have tried various treatment methods for certain illnesses, and those treatments did not work, and then, at the end of the effort, cautery is used, and it proves effective for that specific case.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, the statement that cautery is the last resort in medicine is not true according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish physicians.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except due to the purity and superior substance of gold.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of the cautery doesn't cause harm, although this is not entirely true, for I have tested it and found that this only happens in some bodies and not others.  Cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, just as they said; however, when you perform cautery with gold-fueled fire, it's not clear to you how much gold to use due to the gold's tendency to absorb cold.  If you add too much gold over the heated area, the gold will melt in the fire, causing the artisan to lose control of the process.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cautery with iron is done more easily and more directly towards the correct procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cautery according to sections, and I have arranged them from head to feet, so that the inquirer may find what they want.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for head pain caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is beneficial for dampness and cold affecting the brain, the causes of which are twofold: one is the cause of a large flow of rheumatic fluid, called "corissa," flowing from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears, and a multitude of sleep disorders, toothache, and sore throat.  Generally, all illnesses caused by cold, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar afflictions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, you must order the patient to be purged with laxative medicines, cleansing the head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and constitution.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then you instruct him to shave his head, and have him lie on a smooth bench, placing his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then, place the blade of your palm (or, the blade of the cautery tool)  near the bridge of his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when your middle finger has reached that spot, mark that place with a probe, and then ignite the olive cautery, of which the method is this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that [cautery] upon the spot marked with the probe, so that it descends gradually, your hand being tightened little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and examine the spot.  If you see a significant amount of bone exposed, roughly the size of a grain of millet, then lift your hand; and if not, return your hand with that iron, with another of those [irons], until the bone is visible as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place a cloth soaked in vinegar on it and leave it until the scab from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a four-herb ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, the arm should be raised, because this is better and more helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's tissue has adhered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is adhering to the bone, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery, one should penetrate the back, to strongly press on the bone until the bone breaks, and this is the method of small amputation:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that vapors from the head escape from that location.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery in all cases, only in some individuals, according to a method of fear; and in my opinion, it is better with healing, when it is; for the head is weakened by the interruption of its continuity, as we have testified in other limbs, and especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and by that use and method, healing occurs.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head in a prolonged illness, and treatments using leeches, cupping, head purges, plasters, poultices, cauteries, goose-fat, and similar remedies have been employed, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery which has proven ineffective for the patient, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong constitution, and not frail, and endures considerable coldness, then cauterize with another cautery slightly below the initial one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the corner of their head with a cautery until the affected area is broken open.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the affected area, and expose the bone to the extent that we have described, and cauterize that area on the back of the head, in the location called the 'vas' (or vein) — which is the spot where a cupping device is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very great pain, different from the pain caused by other cauteries on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would place this cautery in its proper location, because the cautery used to cauterize the temples and the back of the head should be a finer instrument than the one used to cauterize the middle of the head; and this is the procedure.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-chronic migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is persistent pain in the head, or spreading pain to the eye, the head should be treated with purifying medicines, and the other treatments mentioned in the descriptions of illnesses should be administered. If none of this works, cauterization in that area can be done in two ways: either by cauterization with a sharp, burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	However, cauterization with a burning medicine involves taking a piece of garlic, squeezing it, and cutting off the tips of both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, with a sharp lancet, cut the painful area on the temple until a small cavity is made under the skin, and it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, apply a compress to the area to firmly constrict it, and leave it for three hours.  After that, remove it, and discard the garlic.  Leave the wound for two or three days, and then apply a piece of cloth soaked in wine until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron, according to this method:  with fire as a cauterizing agent, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs," because the head of it is shaped like a nail, in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand — so that the surrounding flesh is not burned — and rotate the small iron slowly and swiftly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned by the force of the cauterization is as much as half of it, then lift your hand so that the artery beneath is not burned, lest there be a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak a cotton pad in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; and then place a cotton pad soaked in broth, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the sharp edge of the knife-like cautery, and beware of cutting an artery in this particular, not-ancient, procedure.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an old migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment, and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, and the treatment does not work, and sometimes because the illness does not respond to what we have said about the first cauterization with medicine or with fire cauterization, then you should heat the knife-cautery until it is white hot, then apply it to the area of pain in a line the length of half a finger, or that much; and hold your hand steady once, and push until you cut the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to avoid damaging the continuity of the jawbone, which is strained by chewing, and to ensure that the ligaments and nerves that move it are not injured, and that a spasm does not develop.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of the flow of blood from the cut artery, because there is fear in cutting it, and especially for someone who is ignorant of what they are doing and is not skilled and experienced; and leaves the operation unfinished at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from an artery in its own manner, in its own section of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness is not helped by this cauterization and you see the patient's condition as tolerable, cauterize that middle part of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have described in the chapter on cutting arteries with a cautery having two blades, and this is a better and more beneficial cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization of ear aches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear comes from cold and is treated with laxatives and other treatments as described in the previous section, and the pain does not subside, then apply the cautery, and this is the one called a *puncta*, and this is its shape:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then apply the cautery to the affected area, and let it be moved around the entire ear in a circular motion, or in a circuit over each affected spot if the pain is in several places.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery along the ear from the base slowly, after you have marked the area with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery is applied with ten points to the entire ear, then cauterize those spots, and then treat the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumors which are cured by cauterization are only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that arises from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with poultices, emetics, and remedies, and your treatment does not work, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, a second a little below their temple, and the third at the juncture of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery opposite the affected area, for softening occurs only in the area that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery at the right end of the ear, slightly above the corner of the head, and another at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger, and you hold the cautery until the quantity of half of the affected area is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgical procedure, the method of which is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what you have seen; and it is necessary to cut away some of the superfluous flesh.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with whatever was previously used until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On cauterization for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old, and you have treated it with what we have described, but your treatment isn't working and the patient has no fever, then cauterize with four cauteries: on all the corners of their head; and with one cautery on the middle of the head, as we said before; and with a cautery on the temple.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what has been previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the opening of the stomach; and further back; and then it should be treated with what follows.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Concerning the cauterization of forgetfulness caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give the patient at the beginning large jars and pills, clarifying the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then wash the entire head of the patient and place on their forehead a plaster of the kind described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for this is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order which I have already stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so, if this treatment is effective, good; but if not, then apply three cauteries to the back part of his head, descending from the highest part of the head down to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the width of the finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what has been previously described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if the application and the patient tolerate it, then apply a cautery in the middle area; and if you wish a greater application, then cauterize it at both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped, following the previously given form.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization for paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You must proceed with cleansing the head with herbs and as we have said; then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with a cautery on all the horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if in the illness of softening of the body, the patient is enduring it and the illness is severe, then cauterize the patient with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continuously with a cautery until the bone is loosened somewhat, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be an olive cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain from the beginning with herbs and the other treatment we have mentioned in the division when the patient is severe and tolerates the application of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then administer poultices and masticatories that cleanse the brain, doing so for many days, with a beneficial diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then, bind the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of the head, and cauterize on each temple.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize with the cauteries mentioned, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spinal vertebrae of the neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-like, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a small cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Concerning the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries which we have mentioned in the previous discussion of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess tending toward melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give him to drink that which cleanses his brain, according to what has been previously stated in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made cautery to the scalp, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and held steady on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and the best is an old sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with moderate heat, as much as the patient can tolerate when it is applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of the patient's head on the scalp, and leave it until it is cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, with the other treatments, until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that place with small punctures according to the patient's tolerance, but keep your hand with a cautery so it is adequately heated: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in wool or hen's dung.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of descending water in the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have observed the beginning of water in the eye, according to the signs I have mentioned in the previous section, then begin giving the patient drinks that will strengthen his head and guard it from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then order him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize with two cauteries above the two temples if the beginning of the water's infection is in both eyes, or with one on one side if the water's infection is in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are below the crown; and let the cauteries be in that line, at the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from him, stop it with some medicine, as is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of them and the caution of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck below two bones with two cauteries directly applied.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the eyelids are old, and persistently through the veins and arteries, which are in the visible area of the head's exterior, and it is verified that this is superfluous cold phlegm, then cauterize it with the cautery that we have recounted in the chapter about initially applying hot water to sores, and with a cautery in the middle part of the head, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need additional treatment, then cauterize that along the entire eyelid edge on the eyebrow's end with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cauterization of nasal foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we have described in the division, and your treatment is not effective, then prepare and give the patient potions to drink for three nights; and afterwards, shave the patient's head and cauterize with a smaller cautery and an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize the area with a clove-shaped cautery, using two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one each.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the arc, so you don't set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clove-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you cauterize that area above the two eyebrows slightly with two cauteries on every part, and let them be elongated towards the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too hard, but according to the amount that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cautery of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inward and pierce the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inward so that they pierce the eye, cauterization in those cases is in two ways: either with burning or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery using fire, command the patient beforehand to remove their own hairs in the same way that barbers do, until they are drawn out and plucked; and if you pierce the skin near their roots, then you must cover the eyes with a bandage so they are not irritated until the hairs are grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they have grown back and are plucked, place the patient's head in your lap, and then gently press on the eyelid of their eyes with a probe, using a marking that resembles the shape of a myrtle leaf, and have the beginning of the marking near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply cotton soaked in egg white or a ptillium mucilage to the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize along the marked area, little by little, in many applications, until the surface of the skin, which is similar to a myrtle leaf, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid contracted and the hairs raised toward the puncture in the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it for three days, and then apply cotton with a bandage until the scab is removed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	However, if any cause returns to the hair follicles and the eyelid softens, then do the cautery again in the same way as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are beneath the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position, healed, and the hairs no longer prick the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is what you instruct the patient to do to the hairs until they are elongated and healed, and then a leaf-shaped piece of cloth is made resembling a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known medicinal herbs and fresh uncooked lard (or something like that), and thoroughly mix these ingredients quickly so they don't get cold.  Then spread this mixture on the leaf-shaped cloth, and place it over the affected eye(s). Place a cloth soaked in egg white under the eye.  And the patient's head should be supported by you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it gently, and do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning should be like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, when the patient feels the burning sensation, remove the medicine and gently wipe it away with your finger; then, when the burning subsides, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water.  Then see if the eyelid has been raised, just as if it were cured by cauterization with fire or incision; if so, it is good. If not, put more medicine on the area where the previous medicine did not reach, and do not stop until the wound is healed, and the eye is closed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a bandage over it until the burn is healed, and then treat it with a final ointment or other remedy until it is completely cured.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	You must, during your treatment, diligently ensure that no medicine gets into the eye.  If, after a few days, the eyelid becomes softened and something from the lashes enters the eye, then repeat your application of medicine to the softened part of the eyelid, just as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method for treating eye injuries.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that human eye injuries vary in size and severity, and therefore your treatment is tailored accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to healing in this art should not be hidden from the student.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Concerning the cauterization of fistulas in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula, as described in the divisions of diseases, and your treatment is not effective, then you should cauterize it in this manner: instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between your hands, so that it is neither moved nor shaken by the patient's head movements.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of linen soaked in egg white or gum arabic over the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave, like the shape of a reed or a hawk's wing, on the one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, it should be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and extract the pus and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which is well ignited, over it. Hold your hand a short distance from the cautery over the area of the nose, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed. Then place the cautery on the ulcer and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning your cautery reaches the bone, it is good.  But if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary.  Leave it like that for three days, and then apply a compress with wool and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if several days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is smooth according to what is suitable in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier doctors said:  Apply to the area of the fistula and make a hole there. Then, place in that fissure a fine, thin piece of material, such as: and pour into it a quantity of molten lead. Hold your hand firmly on the instrument and prevent the patient from moving, so that the molten lead does not flow onto the wound.  It is necessary to place a compress soaked in egg white or water over the patient's wound.  For molten lead adheres to the fistula area and heals it through a remarkable cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about the cautery and treatment, it is good.  But if not, then it is necessary to administer a trepanation of the nose and reduce the fistula to the nasal cavity, according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of the cauterization of the fissure of the pot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often fissures occur in the lips, and more often in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then heat the small knife-cautery according to this form that is described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity should be according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully apply that heated [cautery] to those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth, an abscess develops, then breaks open, and then becomes chronic, and pus forms and a fistula is created, and then you treat it and the treatment is ineffective, then you must use a heated cautery, according to the size that is found in the fistula, and you must place that heated thing in the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom of it, and behind it they do this one or two times; and then treat it with what we have said about healing until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the pus is cut off and healed, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to expose the area and remove the corrupted bone, according to what will be found in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicine but it doesn't help, then place the patient's head on your lap, and then heat the cautery, the shape of which will be something like this, so that you place the nozzle over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, and hold your hand there briefly so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization a few times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, for the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gum is strengthened, and the corrupt moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or there is cold or a worm there, and you do not consider medical treatment appropriate, then the cauterization in that case is done in two ways: either cauterization with cow dung, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with dung is done by taking cow dung, boiling it in an iron container, then taking a piece of cloth and wrapping it around the end of a probe, immersing it in the boiled dung, and quickly applying it to the aching tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this a few times until the effect of the heat reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the aforementioned dung, place that on the aching tooth, and place the heated iron on top of it until the iron reaches the opening of the tooth cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is done by holding a heated iron or bronze rod, ensuring that it is thick enough so that the heat doesn't reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery iron to the desired temperature, place it on the tooth and hold it there until it cools; do this several times until the pain is gone either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, with the application of this cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and keep it in for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize any extremity as is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of using the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophules.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophules are caused by phlegm and cold humors, and are not responsive to digestion by medicine, and you wish to achieve digestion of them easily, then you heat the cautery, shaped as follows: having two open ends so that smoke escapes from the cautery from one end, and place this heated cautery over the abscess once, and another time if needed, until the heat reaches the base of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then apply the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it on for three days, and place on it a compress soaked in vinegar until that which the fire has burned is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages, and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula, or cautery, should be suitable for this purpose.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of a sore throat and constriction of the windpipe.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity descends upon the bronchial tubes, and especially when it is accompanied by a coldness of constitution, then the patient must first be evacuated with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the affected area near the root of the throat in the depressed location.
